column4: hey all, I'm trying to edit my xorg config to change my monitor setup to shut off my laptop screen if an external monitor is attached.
it seems to work when I'm on the log in screen, but returns back to the original state when I log in
anyone know what could be happening?
on single user?

Recent Ubuntu versions don't really use Xorg.conf. They use different setups which to be honest I'm not 100% familiar with. But you *COULD* use some conditional xrandr settings in your ~/.profile to achieve the effect you're after.
oh interesting
Godspeed, young paduwan!
osnap that will work with xrandr -s (0|1) with my metamodes configured in my xorg config
:D  Figured it would.
the screen going black is an advanced power control setting.
[ "$(xrandr | grep '^Screen 1') != "" ]
[ "$(xrandr | grep '^Screen 1')" != "" ] rather
yup, I figured that would be an option
Might possibly be a screensaver. You wouldn't by any chance be using LXDE?
xset dpms force off <-- seen that before?
erm, don't believe so. where would I have?
Try running it, just for shits and grins.
didn't work.
Was worth a shot.
lololo
Okay?
More likely more like a limitation than a feature.
thanks for your help
